title: Getting Back Into Coding After a Long Break
summary: After almost a year away from serious coding, here's what worked (and what didn't) when I decided to jump back in — tools, routines, mindset shifts, and why small public prototypes beat perfect private plans.

# Getting Back Into Coding After a Long Break

It's 2026 and my last meaningful commit was mid-2025. Life happened — work, family, burnout, side quests. Sound familiar?

## What actually helped me return

1. Tiny public prototypes (like vastreach)
2. One language per day rule (JS Mon–Wed, Haskell Thu–Fri)
3. No zero days — even 15 minutes counts

[... continue ...]

If you're in the same boat, start stupidly small. Push ugly code. The momentum builds faster than you think.
